Comments_List: I gained a better understanding of the basic corporate finance concepts.
Literally everything one needs to know about corporate finance. Intense class but good.
I learned how to value companies' various projects and operation methods as well as how to make decisions based on that information.
I think the course has easy to understand lecture notes. However, I think the content can be a bit more in depth. Much of the content now seems not very practical in real life.

Strength: the key ideas are clear and the course is well structured
Weakness: hope more cases, especially those Corporate Finance flavored, rather than just provide some background knowledge like the financial crisis, could be provided to apply knowledge and skills acquired in class
No weaknesses! Strengths include very detailed powerpoint slides for further study, also great structure of the course, I like how we start off with a quiz.
The class and the professor is good, but it is lack of specific explanations because the professor assumes that the students already learned finance before at least once.
It can be an introductory course towards corporate finance.
Of high practical value and also serves as a gentle survey of the finance field before further studies and practice
Absolutely! For anyone who is considering a career in corporate development or financial services.
Yes, I will. It is a good review and advanced class of Corporate Finance if you have some background knowledge.
